39413554.review:
This is an amazing game, with a very unique mechanic, mixing card games, tactics and city building. At first glance it seems kinda simple and straightforward, but as you play you realize there are many strategies and styles of play that eventually turn to a very deep system. You have to be aware of what your plan is since the first play.

If you like puzzle challenges, cool music, fun mechanics and cute art this is a game you will like

39412875.review:
An easy to learn yet deep strategy planning game with some interesting mechanics that will keep you playing for a while.
My biggest issue was that the deck building soon becomes irrelevant as there aren't many options at all and starting deck cards are quickly replaced by better cards during every game.

+ Fresh and addictive gameplay
+ Rewarding learning curve
+ Well balanced mechanics
+ Polished looking

- Dialogs repeating at every level restart
- The deck building aspect is actually secondary

4/5

39389629.review:
Because of how sexy it looks I’ve wanted to play this game since release, but only recently got around to buying and playing it. And the other day I got the last achievement for 100%.

Good game. It’s an odd combination of super slick presentation, yet still a little rough around the edges. It feels a lot like city-themed boardgames e.g. Between Two Cities, but with a lot more "stuff". Though sometimes that "stuff" seems a bit excessive. e.g. some of the cards feel completely useless or underpowered compared to equivalents at the same tech level, even factoring in the different game modes.

I was aware that it was a city-themed "puzzle" style game rather than a city builder, so unlike other reviewers I didn't suffer any "disappointment" there.

39355383.review:
nice game.
buy it on sale.

39167860.review:
[h1]Fairly good[/h1]

This was a near instant buy for me.  I've got a game on my phone - [url=colepowered.com/megacity-hd/]megacity[/url] by the same developer. Its a fun solo game. If you've played that solo game and enjoy it - this is a good game.  If you're unsure about the game, go spend $0.99 on the phone and play the phone version.  There are quite a few updates to the mechanics of the game to make it more complex and interesting (the vs. mode for example).  Yes, Concrete Jungle is on those devices too.

The game works as a desktop game without problem (that's a gripe on other dual enviroment games I've played).

The game itself is a puzzle / tile placement game.  You play a tile to somewhere on the board and it either is a scoreing tile or one that modifies its surrounding somehow.  Residences want to live next to parks (get more points) and away from industry (get less points)... but industry is necessary for economy to unlock other tiles that change one's draws and tweak the strategy for how to score points.

39128052.review: Good game, very addicting when you get into it.

39114123.review:
How to describe this game? Addictive? Challenging? Puzzly? Yes, yes and yes. 

I was unsure from the purchase page if this was a game for me, so I waited till ti was on sale and it would have been worth it at full price. 

If you like tile-laying board games or Deck building games - this is a must-own!

I've sunk 6+ hours into it so far, and I'm quite certain I'm going to spend many, many more hours on it.

39057591.review: Really enjoying Concrete Jungle! Hours of fun and a chilled game to relax with. Good voice acting and music makes it a much more enjoyable experience than I expected. Gameplay is weighted towards luck over skilled deck management, but for a casual time-passer, it delivers a fun challenge. As a deck building tile puzzler, maybe a stretch to feel the value at full price, but worth picking up in the sales for sure!

39056309.review:
Rather addictive, love that theres voice acting :) 
This is a game that can feed your strategic mind.

39050749.review: A very punishing but ultimately extremely satisfying blend of puzzle, strategy and deck building gameplay. I can't wait to try out my luck against other people!

39005154.review:
Challenging puzzles (coming from a dude who doesn't play puzzle games much).  The deck-building mechanic adds strategy and depth--recommended for fans of deck-building!  

Good voice acting.  Polished, and worth more than the few bucks I spent on it.

Good job!

38813688.review: It's fucking amazing how much depth the developers have managed to juice out of layers of simple mechanics. The normal mode feels a little RNG heavy but the Versus mode is amazing!

38704416.review:
The first few rounds are very fun, then you get the 'Versus' game style explained and forced down your throat, which is by far not as much fun.

#EDIT: I gave one of the Versus levels one more try, beat it and after that, a couple of more solo games became available, so I'm tentatively changing my recommendation. The solo mode is still thoroughly enjoyable but it'd be more fun for me if one could skip the versus game mode. The AI tries to win too hard, which may appeal to more hard core players, but doesn't really have a place in a game this casual, methinks.

38573765.review: Very fun. It accidentally got wiped from my computer so I stopped playing, but while I had it this game was addictive and challenging enough.  The deck building with puzzle game dynamic define the game, and they are well honed. Bonus! It's also funny

38160054.review:
This is a really good strategy game. It is NOT a city-building game, and not really a puzzle game, though it looks like both. It involves placing city elements (houses, parks, warehouses, shopping centers) onto an isometric grid via cards in your deck. The grid regularly scrolls forward, opening up new squares to fill and "scoring" the elements you've already placed (and consigning them to some eternal limbo as they are left behind).

Many elements are worth points (+1, +2, etc.).  Other elements affect the board (and surrounding squares) by adding, subtracting, multiplying, and nullifying scores in specific ways. Although Concrete Jungle is way too complex for my little mind, I recognize it as a very good game. This game is for you if:

* You like "deck-building" games that require you to adapt to random draws
* You can think several moves ahead... no really, several moves ahead. Not just two.
* You want games with solid, colorful graphics.
* You are not easily frustrated by strategy games (like me).
* You don't mind reading (and skipping over) the same dialogue OVER and OVER. And OVER.

Me? I keep playing the first few levels. I can win those. It's really fun!

37693223.review: A great little puzzler which is an extension of a mobile game that I spent hours on!

37279295.review: The only issue with this game is that it ended! Would gladly pay for more content and I cannot wait to see what this developer comes up with next to expand on this incredible game

37172864.review:
This game is getting old now, nethertheless it's still thouroughly enjoyable, and if you are looking for a single-player puzzle game that is oddly similar to a sort of sims... card deck building... chess game, then this is the game for you.
With plenty of levels, a nice veriety of the types of levels, a storys that's just sort of there and you don't need to pay any attention to it but it's there so why not, and a fun endless mode that I have a score so high on I think if I win/loose it will be record breaking, this game has enough content to keep you playing for hours. I have over 50, and more if I wanted to but I have too many games.
If you have a logical mind and can look ahead a good 10 moves, then this game will satisfy you so damn much. Like playing, filling the whole grid and leaving just one space on eah row so you can just play it one after the other, clearing the rows are getting the multipliers... Just writing this is making me want to play it again!

Would highly recomend, and it's a reasonable price for the quality of the game you get.

39510472.review:
What is Concrete Jungle?

Genre: isometric city-building cards puzzling 
Setting: megacity getting developed by different characters by placing and melting cards
Difficulty: 9/10 - short tutorial, much trial and error, tough AI
Length: 10-25 hours for a campaign walkthrough 
Mode: singleplayer campaign, solo arcade modes, local multiplayer
Similar games: What do I know! I usually don't play this kind of games. Go find out yourself!


What's good about Concrete Jungle?

- nice and funny story about a growing city, neat voice acting
- various characters to play with with different abilities and playstyles
- wide variety of cards
- smooth and well-working game mechanics! Tons of fun, tons of fun.


Neutral:

- The game is generally tough. As there are no difficulty settings, you'll misuse cards a lot, lose in early stages, have a hard time beating the last levels. To master those, you have to know the cards and put them to good use in order to win


The negative aspects:

- short tutorial
- only 14 levels - too short!


Result (and summary for those who have no time reading):

Usually not playing puzzle games, this game got me addicted quickly. After a stuttering start, getting to knowing cards and characters opens up a variety of possibilities to ensure victory. And you have to, the end-game confronts you with a smart but hard to beat AI. Such a shame the campaign only consists of 14 levels - yet it tells a funny story with comical characters!


Definitely worth the price!
